items.title: How a 1963 Cleveland Case Shaped Stop-and-Frisk Police Tactics, and Why It Still Matters

items.title: Dozens of Prisoners Allege a Culture of Violence by Guards at Federal Facility in Virginia
items.description: In lawsuits and interviews, people held at Lee penitentiary described correctional officers breaking teeth, fracturing ribs and using the N-word.

items.title: What I Learned From a Year of Reading Letters From Prisoners
items.description: The Marshall Project receives nearly 3,000 letters a year from people behind bars. Each one tells a different story about the system’s harms.
